products.description: Rolex was founded in 1905 by Hans Wilsdorf and Alfred Davis in London and later moved to Geneva. It gained fame for innovations like the first waterproof watch, the Oyster, in 1926, and the self-winding Perpetual rotor in 1931. Known for iconic models like the Submariner and Daytona, Rolex has become a symbol of luxury and precision in watchmaking.

Audemars Piguet was founded in 1875 by Jules-Louis Audemars and Edward Piguet in Le Brassus, Switzerland. Renowned for its high-quality craftsmanship, the brand introduced its first wristwatch in 1882. In 1972, Audemars Piguet revolutionized the watch industry with the launch of the Royal Oak, the first luxury sports watch, which blended elegance with a bold design. The brand continues to be celebrated for its innovative designs and exceptional artistry, maintaining a prestigious reputation in the luxury watch market.
Panerai Submersible watches are built for deep dives, with advanced water resistance and a rugged design.
This Rolex GMT Master II features the iconic rotating bezel and dual time zone functionality, a favorite among travelers since its introduction.
The Rolex Yacht-Master is designed for sailing enthusiasts, with a bidirectional bezel and water resistance, blending luxury with sportiness.
Rolex Sea-Dweller is a legendary diver’s watch, engineered to withstand great depths, making it a professional tool for underwater exploration.
The Rolex Submariner ‘Kermit’ with its green bezel is a collector's favorite, celebrating the 50th anniversary of the iconic Submariner.
The Rolex GMT Master II ‘Coke’ features the signature red and black bezel, a favorite among collectors for its unique style and functionality.
